alert.note: Alert for McIntosh (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 2:41PM CST until January 14 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 5 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...McIntosh County. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 6 PM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the Thursday evening and Friday morning commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
